data.enText: fall
to fall or allow sth to fall by accident

data.chText: 攀登者一失足掉下去摔死了。
data.enText: The climber slipped and dropped to his death.
Be careful not to drop that plate.
to fall or make sth fall deliberately

data.chText: 他蹒跚着走进来，一屁股坐在椅子上。
data.enText: He staggered in and dropped into a chair.

data.chText: 正在向灾区空投医药用品。
data.enText: Medical supplies are being dropped into the stricken area.

data.chText: 他松开腰带，裤子掉下去。
data.enText: He dropped his trousers (= undid them and let them fall) .

data.chText: 他松开腰带，裤子掉下去。
data.enText: He dropped his pants.
to fall down or be no longer able to stand because you are extremely tired
I feel ready to drop .

data.chText: 她巴不得人人都干到累垮为止。
data.enText: She expects everyone to work till they drop.
become weaker/less
to become or make sth weaker, lower or less
The temperature has dropped considerably.
At last the wind dropped.

data.chText: 他的声音已放低到轻声细语了。
data.enText: His voice dropped to a whisper.
The Dutch team have dropped to fifth place.
The price of shares dropped by 14p.
Shares dropped in price by 14p.
She dropped her voice dramatically.

data.chText: 在房屋密集区必须放慢速度。
data.enText: You must drop your speed in built-up areas.
eyes
to look down

data.chText: 她双目低垂，看着自己的腿。
data.enText: Her eyes dropped to her lap.
slope downwards
to slope steeply downwards

data.chText: 他们前面的山谷从路旁急剧倾斜而下。
data.enText: In front of them the valley dropped sharply away from the road.
deliver/send
to stop so that sb can get out of a car, etc.; to deliver sth on the way to somewhere else

data.chText: 你可以让我在银行附近下车吗？
data.enText: Can you drop me near the bank?

data.chText: 你忘了拿你的短上衣，不过我可以在明天上班的路上顺便捎给你。
data.enText: You left your jacket, but I can drop it off on my way to work tomorrow.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: to send a short letter to sb

data.chText: 你到那儿后给我写封信。
data.enText: Drop me a line when you get there.
leave out
to leave sb/sth out by accident or deliberately

data.chText: 她因受伤而未被列入队员名单。
data.enText: She's been dropped from the team because of injury.

data.chText: 他讲话带着伦敦东区的口音，把词首的h音给吞掉了。
data.enText: He spoke with a cockney accent and dropped his aitches (= did not pronounce the letter ‘h’ at the start of words) .
friends

data.chText: 不再与（某人）往来；同（某人）断绝联系
data.enText: to stop seeing sb socially

data.chText: 她已与多数老朋友停止了来往。
data.enText: She's dropped most of her old friends.
stop
to stop doing or discussing sth; to not continue with sth
I dropped German (= stopped studying it) when I was 14.

data.chText: 放下所有事情赶快来吧！
data.enText: Drop everything and come at once!

data.chText: 喂，这事儿能不能就谈到这儿？
data.enText: Look, can we just drop it (= stop talking about it) ?

data.chText: 我认为我们最好不要再谈这个话题。
data.enText: I think we'd better drop the subject .

data.chText: 咱们免去俗套——叫我迈克好了。
data.enText: Let's drop the formalities─please call me Mike.

data.chText: 警方决定撤回对她的指控。
data.enText: The police decided to drop the charges against her.
hint
to say or do sth in order to show sb, in an indirect way, what you are thinking
in knitting
to let a stitch go off the needle
drop the ball
to make a mistake and spoil sth that you are responsible for
drop a brick/clanger
to say sth that offends or embarrasses sb, although you did not intend to
drop dead
to die suddenly and unexpectedly
used to tell sb, rudely, to stop annoying you, interfering , etc.
drop sb in it

data.chText: （尤指因泄露秘密）使尴尬，使狼狈不堪
data.enText: to put sb in an embarrassing situation, especially by telling a secret that you should not have told
drop names

data.chText: 提及自己认识或见过的名人以抬高身价
data.enText: to mention famous people you know or have met in order to impress others
drop your bundle
to suddenly not be able to think clearly; to act in a stupid way because you have lost control over yourself
let sb/sth drop
to do or say nothing more about sb/sth

data.chText: 我建议咱们别再提及此事。
data.enText: I suggest we let the matter drop.
to mention sb/sth in a conversation, by accident or as if by accident

data.chText: 他有意无意地提起首相是他的密友。
data.enText: He let it drop that the Prime Minister was a close friend of his.
the bottom drops/falls out (of sth)
people stop buying or using the products of a particular industry

data.chText: 旅游市场出现了萧条局面。
data.enText: The bottom has fallen out of the travel market.
die/fall/drop like flies
to die or fall down in very large numbers
People were dropping like flies in the intense heat.

data.id-g-sent: you could/can hear a pin drop

data.enText: sb's jaw dropped/fell/sagged

data.chText: （突然吃惊或失望得）张口结舌，目瞪口呆，垂头丧气
data.enText: used to say that sb suddenly looked surprised, shocked or disappointed
drop/dump sth in sb's lap
to make sth the responsibility of another person

data.chText: 他们把问题断然给我推了回来。
data.enText: They dropped the problem firmly back in my lap.
the penny drops

data.chText: 恍然大悟；终于明白；茅塞顿开
data.enText: used to say that sb has finally understood or realized sth that they had not understood or realized before
drop away
to become weaker or less

data.chText: 她感到紧张气氛缓和了下来。
data.enText: She could feel the tension drop away.
drop back/behind
drop behind sb
to move or fall into position behind sb else

data.chText: 我们可担当不起落后于竞争对手的后果。
data.enText: We cannot afford to drop behind our competitors.
drop by/in/round
drop in on sb
drop into sth
to pay an informal visit to a person or a place
Drop by sometime.

data.chText: 我曾想路过时顺便来看看你。
data.enText: I thought I'd drop in on you while I was passing.

data.chText: 对不起，我们迟到了——我们半路上顺便到酒馆坐了坐。
data.enText: Sorry we're late─we dropped into the pub on the way.
drop off
to fall into a light sleep

data.chText: 我打了个盹儿，错过了影片的结尾。
data.enText: I dropped off and missed the end of the film.
to become fewer or less

data.chText: 这条旁道通车后，城里来往的车辆就减少了。
data.enText: Traffic in the town has dropped off since the bypass opened.
drop out (of sth)
to no longer take part in or be part of sth
He has dropped out of active politics.

data.chText: 该语言中已废弃的一个词
data.enText: a word that has dropped out of the language
to leave school, college, etc. without finishing your studies

data.chText: 她在攻读学位仅一年后就退学了。
data.enText: She started a degree but dropped out after only a year.
to reject the ideas and ways of behaving that are accepted by the rest of society
of liquid
a very small amount of liquid that forms a round shape
drops of rain
a drop of blood
a small quantity of a liquid

data.chText: 给我在咖啡里多加点牛奶好吗？
data.enText: Could I have a drop more milk in my coffee, please?
I haven't touched a drop (= drunk any alcohol) all evening.
fall
a fall or reduction in the amount, level or number of sth
a drop in prices/temperature, etc.

data.chText: 利润大幅度 / 急剧下降
data.enText: a dramatic/sharp drop in profits
a five per cent drop
distance
a distance down from a high point to a lower point

data.chText: 距下面的岩石有五十米的垂直距离。
data.enText: There was a sheer drop of fifty metres to the rocks below.
a twenty-foot drop
medicine
a liquid medicine that you put one drop at a time into your eyes, ears or nose
eye drops
delivering
the act of delivering sb/sth in a vehicle or by plane; the act of dropping sth

data.chText: 援助机构正组织力量向战区平民运送食品。
data.enText: Aid agencies are organizing food drops to civilians in the war zone.
a parachute drop
sweet/candy
a small round sweet/candy of the type mentioned
fruit drops
cough drops (= sweets/candy to help a cough)
at the drop of a hat
immediately; without hesitating

data.chText: 公司不可能指望我立即搬家。
data.enText: The company can't expect me to move my home and family at the drop of a hat.
a drop in the ocean
a drop in the bucket
an amount of sth that is too small or unimportant to make any real difference to a situation

ex.chText: 飞往纽约的班机取消了。
ex.enText: The flight to New York was cancelled.
The project to build the dam was cancelled.

synonyms.bx: 指取消已安排或决定好的计划等。

ex.chText: 他已经放弃了一切希望。
由于缺乏资金，他们中止了这项工程。
ex.enText: They abandoned the project due to lack of funds.

synonyms.bx: 指因困难太多、无法继续下去而放弃做某事。

ex.chText: 放下所有的事情立即到这里来。
ex.enText: Drop everything and come here immediately.

trans: 中途放下（某人）；中途卸下（某物）
拒绝接受传统规范；离经叛道；摈弃社会习俗

example: they expected the drop would be successful

tr: a central depository where things can be left or picked up
a curtain that can be lowered and raised onto a stage from the flies
a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity
example: a drop of 57 points on the Dow Jones index
there was a drop in pressure in the pulmonary artery
a dip in prices
when that became known the price of their stock went into free fall

tr: a free and rapid descent by the force of gravity
example: it was a miracle that he survived the drop from that height

tr: a predetermined hiding place for the deposit and distribution of illicit goods (such as drugs or stolen property)
a steep high face of rock
example: he stood on a high cliff overlooking the town
a steep drop

tr: a small indefinite quantity (especially of a liquid)
example: he had a drop too much to drink
a drop of each sample was analyzed
there is not a drop of pity in that man
years afterward, they would pay the blood-money, driblet by driblet"--Kiplin

tr: a shape that is spherical and small
example: he studied the shapes of low-viscosity drops
beads of sweat on his forehead
The cow dropped her calf this morning
Her condition deteriorated
Conditions in the slums degenerated
The discussion devolved into a shouting match

tr: fall or sink into a state of exhaustion or death
example: shop til you drop
drop a lawsuit
knock it off!
Stock prices dropped

tr: change from one level to another
example: She dropped into army jargon
How could I miss that typo?
The workers on the conveyor belt miss one out of ten

tr: omit (a letter or syllable) in speaking or writing
example: New Englanders drop their post-vocalic r's
drop a hint
The Giants dropped 11 of their first 13

tr: take (a drug, especially LSD), by mouth
example: She dropped acid when she was a teenager

tr: cause to fall by or as if by delivering a blow
example: strike down a tree
Lightning struck down the hikers
unload the cargo
drop off the passengers at the hotel
he shed his image as a pushy boss
shed your clothes

tr: let or cause to fall in drops
example: dribble oil into the mixture
the bombs are dropping on enemy targets
Don't drop the dishes

tr: fall or descend to a lower place or level
example: He sank to his knees
spend money
drop him from the Republican ticket
They dropped her after she had a child out of wedlock
the ornaments dangled from the tree
The light dropped from the ceiling

value.def: If a level or amount drops or if someone or something drops it, it quickly becomes less.

example.ex: Temperatures can drop to freezing at night...
example.tran: 夜间温度可能会降到零度以下。

example.ex: Once the rate rises it never drops back to its previous level...
example.tran: 一旦价格上去了就再也不会降到以前的水平了。

example.ex: His blood pressure had dropped severely...
example.tran: 他的血压下降得很严重。

example.ex: He had dropped the price of his London home by £1.25m.
example.tran: 他已将他在伦敦的房子价格降了125万英镑。

example.ex: He was prepared to take a drop in wages...
example.tran: 他已做好心理准备接受降薪。

example.ex: The poll indicates a drop in support for the Conservatives.
example.tran: 民意测验表明保守党支持率有所下降。

value.def: If you drop something, you accidentally let it fall.

example.ex: I dropped my glasses and broke them.
example.tran: 我不小心把眼镜掉下来摔碎了。

value.def: If something drops onto something else, it falls onto that thing. If something drops from somewhere, it falls from that place.

example.ex: He felt hot tears dropping onto his fingers...
example.tran: 他感觉到热泪掉到他的手指上。

example.ex: Burning embers started dropping from the ceiling...
example.tran: 余火未尽的木块开始从天花板上往下掉。

example.ex: His toupee dropped off, revealing his bald head.
example.tran: 他的假发掉了,露出了光头。

value.def: If you drop something somewhere or if it drops there, you deliberately let it fall there.

example.ex: Drop the noodles into the water...
example.tran: 将面条下到水里。

example.ex: He dropped his plate into the sink.
example.tran: 他把盘子丢到水槽里。

example.ex: ...shaped pots that simply drop into their own container...
example.tran: 可轻松放入配套的盒子里、有特制外形的锅具

example.ex: Bombs drop round us and the floor shudders.
example.tran: 炸弹落在我们周围,地板在颤抖。

example.ex: ...the dropping of the first atomic bomb.
example.tran: 第一颗原子弹的投放

value.def: If a person or a part of their body drops to a lower position, or if they drop a part of their body to a lower position, they move to that position, often in a tired and lifeless way.

example.ex: Nancy dropped into a nearby chair...
example.tran: 南希疲惫地瘫坐到近处的椅子上。

example.ex: She let her head drop...
example.tran: 她低垂着头。

example.ex: He dropped his hands on to his knees.
example.tran: 他将双手垂放在腿上。

value.def: To drop is used in expressions such as to be about to drop and to dance until you drop to emphasize that you are exhausted and can no longer continue doing something.

example.ex: She looked about to drop...
example.tran: 她看上去快要累垮了。

example.ex: You have to run until you drop.
example.tran: 一直跑到你跑不动为止。

value.def: If a man drops his trousers, he pulls them down, usually as a joke or to be rude.

example.ex: A couple of boozy revellers dropped their trousers.
example.tran: 两名醉酒的狂欢者脱掉了他们的裤子。

value.def: If your voice drops or if you drop your voice, you speak more quietly.

example.ex: Her voice will drop to a dismissive whisper...
example.tran: 她会把声音压低，轻蔑地低语。

example.ex: He dropped his voice and glanced round at the door.
example.tran: 他放低了声音，在门口环视了一下。

value.def: If you drop someone or something somewhere, you take them somewhere and leave them there, usually in a car or other vehicle.

example.ex: He dropped me outside the hotel...
example.tran: 他把我送到了酒店。

example.ex: Many children had been dropped at the stadium by their parents...
example.tran: 很多孩子被家长送到了体育馆。

example.ex: Tim had dropped the letter in earlier.
example.tran: 蒂姆早些时候把信送来了。

example.ex: Just drop me off at the airport...
example.tran: 就让我在机场下好了。

example.ex: He was dropping off a late birthday present.
example.tran: 他正在送一份迟到的生日礼物。

value.tran: 中途放下（某人）;中途卸下（某物）

value.def: If you drop an idea, course of action, or habit, you do not continue with it.

example.ex: He was told to drop the idea...
example.tran: 他被告知要打消那个主意。

example.ex: The prosecution was forced to drop the case...
example.tran: 控方被迫撤诉。

example.ex: Many nations still had not dropped sanctions against South Africa.
example.tran: 很多国家还没有终止对南非的制裁。

example.ex: This was one of the factors that led to President Suharto's dropping of his previous objections.
example.tran: 这是导致苏哈托总统放弃其先前异议的因素之一。

value.def: If someone is dropped by a sports team or organization, they are no longer included in that team or employed by that organization.

example.ex: The country's captain was dropped from the tour party to England.
example.tran: 该国的国家队队长无缘英格兰之行。

value.def: If you drop a game or part of a game in a sports competition, you lose it.

example.ex: Oremans has yet to drop a set.
example.tran: 奥尔曼斯还一局未输。

value.def: If you drop to a lower position in a sports competition, you move to that position.

example.ex: Britain has dropped from second to third place in the league.
example.tran: 英国在联赛中的排名从第二位降到了第三位。

value.def: A drop of a liquid is a very small amount of it shaped like a little ball. In informal English, you can also use drop when you are referring to a very small amount of something such as a drink.

example.ex: ...a drop of blue ink...
example.tran: 一滴蓝墨水

example.ex: Add the cream a few drops at a time...
example.tran: 每次加几滴奶油。

example.ex: I'll have another drop of that Italian milk.
example.tran: 我还要喝点那种意大利牛奶。

value.def: Drops are a kind of medicine which you put drop by drop into your ears, eyes, or nose.

example.ex: ...eye drops.
example.tran: 眼药水

value.def: Fruit or chocolate drops are small round sweets with a fruit or chocolate flavour.
value.tran: (水果味或巧克力味的)糖豆，糖果粒

value.def: You use drop to talk about vertical distances. For example, a thirty-foot drop is a distance of thirty feet between the top of a cliff or wall and the bottom of it.

example.ex: There was a sheer drop just outside my window...
example.tran: 我的窗外就是垂直深渊。

example.ex: It's only a four-foot drop.
example.tran: 仅有 4 英尺的落差。

value.tran: 落差;垂直距离;下降距离

value.boxu_tran: 不要混淆 drop 和 fall。二者均可指东西无意中掉落, 但是fall 不可接宾语，所以不可说someone falls something，却可说they drop something或者somehting drops。如，Leaves were falling to the ground（树叶落到了地上），He dropped his cigar（他扔掉了雪茄），Plate after plate dropped from his fingers（盘子一个接一个地从他指间掉落）。drop 还可指人从某物上跳下, 例如从飞机上跳伞。fall 指人时, 通常指人意外摔倒。如，He stumbled and fell（他绊了一下, 摔倒了）。drop 和 fall 均可用作名词。drop 作名词可指某人想象中物体降落的高度：Sixteen hundred feet is a considerable drop（1, 600 英尺是非常高的垂直距离了）。fall 指意外的跌落：I had been badly bruised by the fall（我摔得鼻青脸肿）。
value.boxu_usage: Do not confuse drop and fall. Although things can drop or fall by accident, note that fall is not followed by an object, so you cannot say that someone 'falls' something. However, you can say that they drop something, or that something drops. Leaves were falling to the ground... He dropped his cigar... Plate after plate dropped from his fingers. You say that a person drops when they jump straight down from something, for example, when someone jumps from a plane using a parachute. If someone falls it is usually because of an accident. He stumbled and fell. Drop and fall are also nouns. A drop is the height of something when you imagine falling off it. Sixteen hundred feet is a considerable drop. A fall is what happens when someone has an accident. I had been badly bruised by the fall.

value.def: If you drop a hint, you give a hint or say something in a casual way.

example.ex: If I drop a few hints he might give me a cutting.
example.tran: 如果我给点暗示，他没准会送我一段插枝。

value.def: If you want someone to drop the subject ,drop it, or let it drop, you want them to stop talking about something, often because you are annoyed that they keep talking about it.

example.ex: Mary Ann wished he would just drop it...
example.tran: 玛丽·安希望他就不要谈论它了。

example.ex: Does that mean you're going to drop the subject?
example.tran: 那是不是意味着你将不再谈论那个话题了？

value.tran: (常指因不喜欢而让别人)终止谈论，不要谈论，谈到此为止

xrse.def: at the drop of a hat

trans: 壓力降；压强降；压力损失；压降；压力降
退学；退出（比赛等）；拒绝接受传统规范；离经叛道；摈弃社会习俗
一滴一滴地；水滴；点点滴滴；一滴一滴
拖动；拖曳及放下；鼠标拖放；拖放功能；拖曳
中途放下（某人）；中途卸下（某物）；打瞌睡；睡着；减退；减少
